Utterance: Hi there! It’s good to see you again. How have you been?
Hi Ellie! I’ve been okay, I did get to go hiking a couple of times.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did it feel?
It felt great. I really enjoyed being out in nature.
I’m glad you took that time for yourself. Did you notice any changes in your mood after those hikes?
Yeah, I felt more energized and less stressed afterward.
That’s fantastic! It seems like getting outside is beneficial for you. Did you have a chance to talk to your wife about your feelings?
I did, actually. It went really well. She appreciated me opening up.
That’s excellent! How did it feel to share your feelings with her?
It felt like a relief. I think it helped both of us.
That’s great to hear. Communication can really strengthen relationships. How has your mother-in-law been doing?
She’s still the same, unfortunately. It’s hard to watch.
I can only imagine how difficult that must be for you and your wife. Have you been able to find support for yourself during this time?
I’ve been trying to talk to friends more, but it’s still tough.
That’s a good step. Sometimes, just sharing with friends can lighten the load. Have you found any specific conversations helpful?
Yeah, one friend who went through something similar really understood.
That’s valuable. It helps to share with someone who can relate. How about your back injury? Have you looked into any physical therapy options?
I did some research, and I found a couple of places nearby.
That’s great progress! Have you thought about scheduling an appointment?
I’m thinking about it. I want to make sure it’s the right fit for me.
That makes sense. It’s important to feel comfortable with whoever you choose. If you need help deciding, we can talk about it next time.
That would be helpful, thanks.
Absolutely. How has your sleep been lately?
A little better, I think. I’ve been trying to use some of the breathing techniques we talked about.
That’s a positive step! Have you noticed any specific techniques that work better for you?
I find that focusing on the breathing helps, especially when I visualize that peaceful place.
That’s wonderful! Visualization can be a powerful tool. Would you like to build on that technique today?
Sure, I’d like that.
Okay, let’s take a moment to breathe in deeply… and out. Now, picture yourself in that peaceful forest again.
<breathes>
Great. As you visualize, notice how your body feels. Are there any areas of tension?
I can feel a bit of tension in my shoulders.
Let’s focus on that. As you breathe out, imagine the tension melting away.
<breathes out>
Good. How does that feel?
A little better, actually.
Excellent! You can use this visualization anytime you feel stressed. Would you like to set a goal to practice this technique regularly?
Yes, I’ll try to do it every night before bed.
That sounds like a great plan. Let’s check in on that next time. Is there anything else you want to discuss today?
Just feeling a bit anxious about the future, with everything going on.
That’s completely understandable. It’s a lot to process. What specifically makes you feel anxious?
I worry about my wife and what will happen next with her mom.
It’s natural to feel that way. Have you found any strategies to cope with that anxiety?
I’ve been trying to stay busy, but it doesn’t always work.
Staying busy can be a distraction, but it’s also important to process those feelings. Would you be open to journaling about your thoughts?
I could try that.
Journaling can help you express and understand your feelings better. We can discuss how that goes in our next session.
Okay, I’ll give it a shot.
Thank you for sharing today. Remember to be gentle with yourself. I’m here to support you through this.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate it a lot.
You’re welcome! Looking forward to our next session. Take care!
Bye!
